00039 #include <config.h>
00040 #include <mpi.h>
00041 #include <stdio.h>
00042 #include <stdlib.h>
00043 #include <string.h>
00044 #include <sys/types.h>
00045 #include <asm/types.h>
00046 #include <sys/stat.h>
00047 #include <fcntl.h>
00048 #include <unistd.h>
00049 #include <sys/ioctl.h>
00050 #include <getopt.h>
00051 #include <errno.h>

00053 #include <lustre/lustreapi.h>
00054 #include "lp_utils.h"
00055 #ifndef _IOWR
00056 # include <ioctl.h>
00057 #endif
00058 
00059 
00060 int rank = 0;
00061 int size = 0;
00062 
00063 char *testdir = NULL;
00064 
00065 void rw_file(char *name, long stride, unsigned int seed)
00066 {
00067         char filename[MAX_FILENAME_LEN];
00068         char errmsg[MAX_FILENAME_LEN+20];
00069         char *buf, *o_buf;
00070         struct lov_user_md lum = {0};
00071         int fd, rc, i, bad = 0, root = 0;
00072         long off;
00073         long page_size = sysconf(_SC_PAGESIZE);
00074 
00075         sprintf(filename, "%s/%s", testdir, name);
00076 
00077         if (rank == 0) {
00078                 remove_file_or_dir(filename);
00079 
00080                 lum.lmm_magic = LOV_USER_MAGIC;
00081                 lum.lmm_stripe_size = 0;
00082                 lum.lmm_stripe_count = 0;
00083                 lum.lmm_stripe_offset = -1;
00084 
00085                 fd = open(filename, O_CREAT | O_RDWR | O_LOV_DELAY_CREATE,
00086                           FILEMODE);
00087                 if (fd == -1) {
00088                         sprintf(errmsg, "open of file %s", filename);
00089                         FAIL(errmsg);
00090                 }
00091 
00092                 rc = ioctl(fd, LL_IOC_LOV_SETSTRIPE, &lum);
00093                 if (rc == -1) {
00094                         sprintf(errmsg, "ioctl SETSTRIPE of file %s", filename);
00095                         FAIL(errmsg);
00096                 }
00097 
00098                 if (close(fd) == -1) {
00099                         sprintf(errmsg, "close of file %s", filename);
00100                         FAIL(errmsg);
00101                 }
00102         }
00103 
00104         MPI_Barrier(MPI_COMM_WORLD);
00105 
00106         if (stride < 0) {
00107                 if (rank == 0) {
00108                         srandom(seed);
00109                         while (stride < page_size/2) {
00110                                 stride = random();
00111                                 stride -= stride % 16;
00112                                 if (stride < 0)
00113                                         stride = -stride;
00114                                 stride %= 2 * lum.lmm_stripe_size;
00115                         }
00116                 }
00117 
00118                 MPI_Barrier(MPI_COMM_WORLD);
00119 
00120                 MPI_Bcast(&stride, 1, MPI_LONG, root, MPI_COMM_WORLD);
00121         }
00122 
00123         MPI_Barrier(MPI_COMM_WORLD);
00124 
00125         buf = (char *)malloc(stride);
00126         if (buf == NULL) {
00127                 sprintf(errmsg, "malloc of buf with size %ld", stride);
00128                 FAIL(errmsg);
00129         }
00130 
00131         if (rank == 0) {
00132                 fd = open(filename, O_RDWR);
00133                 if (fd == -1) {
00134                         sprintf(errmsg, "open of file %s", filename);
00135                         FAIL(errmsg);
00136                 }
00137 
00138                 off = 0;
00139                 fill_stride(buf, stride, 0, off);
00140                 rc = write(fd, buf, stride);
00141                 if (rc != stride) {
00142                         sprintf(errmsg, "write of file %s return %d",
00143                                 filename, rc);
00144                         FAIL(errmsg);
00145                 }
00146                 off += stride;
00147 
00148                 while (off < size * stride) {
00149                         fill_stride(buf, stride, 0x8080808080808080ULL, off);
00150                         rc = write(fd, buf, stride);
00151                         if (rc != stride) {
00152                                 sprintf(errmsg, "write of file %s return %d",
00153                                         filename, rc);
00154                                 FAIL(errmsg);
00155                         }
00156 
00157                         off += stride;
00158                 }
00159 
00160                 if (close(fd) == -1) {
00161                         sprintf(errmsg, "close of file %s", filename);
00162                         FAIL(errmsg);
00163                 }
00164         }
00165 
00166         MPI_Barrier(MPI_COMM_WORLD);
00167 
00168         o_buf = (char *)malloc(stride);
00169         if (o_buf == NULL) {
00170                 sprintf(errmsg, "malloc of o_buf with size %ld", stride);
00171                 FAIL(errmsg);
00172         }
00173 
00174         fd = open(filename, O_RDWR);
00175         if (fd == -1) {
00176                 sprintf(errmsg, "open of file %s", filename);
00177                 FAIL(errmsg);
00178         }
00179 
00180         off = 0;
00181         for (i = 1; i < size; ++i) {
00182                 if (rank == i) {
00183                         rc = lseek(fd, off, SEEK_SET);
00184                         if (rc != off) {
00185                                 sprintf(errmsg, "lseek of file %s return %d",
00186                                         filename, rc);
00187                                 FAIL(errmsg);
00188                         }
00189 
00190                         rc = read(fd, buf, stride);
00191                         if (rc != stride) {
00192                                 if (rc > 0) {
00193                                         fill_stride(o_buf, rc, i - 1, off);
00194                                         dump_diff(o_buf, buf, rc, off);
00195                                 }
00196                                 sprintf(errmsg, "read of file %s return %d",
00197                                         filename, rc);
00198                                 FAIL(errmsg);
00199                         }
00200 
00201                         fill_stride(o_buf, stride, i - 1, off);
00202                         if (memcmp(o_buf, buf, stride) != 0) {
00203                                 dump_diff(o_buf, buf, stride, off);
00204                                 errno = 0;
00205                                 sprintf(errmsg, "Error: diff data read from %s",
00206                                         filename);
00207                                 FAIL(errmsg);
00208                         }
00209                 }
00210 
00211                 off += stride;
00212 
00213                 if (rank == i) {
00214                         fill_stride(buf, stride, i, off);
00215                         rc = write(fd, buf, stride);
00216                         if (rc != stride) {
00217                                 sprintf(errmsg, "write of file %s return %d",
00218                                         filename, rc);
00219                                 FAIL(errmsg);
00220                         }
00221                 }
00222 
00223                 MPI_Barrier(MPI_COMM_WORLD);
00224         }
00225 
00226         if (close(fd) == -1) {
00227                 sprintf(errmsg, "close of file %s", filename);
00228                 FAIL(errmsg);
00229         }
00230 
00231         MPI_Barrier(MPI_COMM_WORLD);
00232 
00233         if (rank == 0) {
00234                 fd = open(filename, O_RDONLY);
00235                 if (fd == -1) {
00236                         sprintf(errmsg, "open of file %s", filename);
00237                         FAIL(errmsg);
00238                 }
00239 
00240                 off = 0;
00241                 for (i = 0; i < size; ++i) {
00242                         rc = read(fd, buf, stride);
00243                         if (rc != stride) {
00244                                 if (rc > 0) {
00245                                         fill_stride(o_buf, rc, i, off);
00246                                         dump_diff(o_buf, buf, rc, off);
00247                                 }
00248                                 sprintf(errmsg, "read of file %s", filename);
00249                                 FAIL(errmsg);
00250                         }
00251 
00252                         fill_stride(o_buf, stride, i, off);
00253                         if (memcmp(o_buf, buf, stride) != 0) {
00254                                 bad = 1;
00255                                 dump_diff(o_buf, buf, stride, off);
00256                         }
00257                         off += stride;
00258                 }
00259                 if (bad == 1) {
00260                         errno = 0;
00261                         sprintf(errmsg, "Error: diff data read from %s", filename);
00262                         FAIL(errmsg);
00263                 }
00264         }
00265 
00266         MPI_Barrier(MPI_COMM_WORLD);
00267         fprintf(stderr, "passed barrier 5\n");
00268 
00269         free(buf);
00270         free(o_buf);
00271 }
00272 
00273 void cascading_rw(long stride, unsigned int seed)
00274 {
00275         begin("setup");
00276         end("setup");
00277 
00278         begin("test");
00279         rw_file("cascading_rw", stride, seed);
00280         end("test");
00281 
00282         begin("cleanup");
00283         remove_file("cascading_rw");
00284         end("cleanup");
00285 }
00286 
00287 void usage(char *proc)
00288 {
00289         int i;
00290 
00291         if (rank == 0) {
00292                 printf("Usage: %s [-h] -d <testdir> [-s \"1024\"]\n", proc);
00293                 printf("           [-n \"13\"] [-e \"12345\"]\n"); 
00294                 printf("           [-v] [-V #] [-g]\n");
00295                 printf("\t-h: prints this help message\n");
00296                 printf("\t-d: the directory in which the tests will run\n");
00297                 printf("\t-s: process stride size\n");
00298                 printf("\t-n: repeat test # times\n");
00299                 printf("\t-n: random seed, used to re-create previous runs\n");
00300                 printf("\t-v: increase the verbositly level by 1\n");
00301                 printf("\t-V: select a specific verbosity level\n");
00302                 printf("\t-g: debug mode\n");
00303         }
00304 
00305         MPI_Initialized(&i);
00306         if (i) MPI_Finalize();
00307         exit(0);
00308 }
00309 
00310 int main(int argc, char *argv[])
00311 {
00312         int i, iterations = 16, c;
00313         long stride = -1;
00314         unsigned int seed = 0;
00315 
00316         /* Check for -h parameter before MPI_Init so the binary can be
00317            called directly, without, for instance, mpirun */
00318         for (i = 1; i < argc; ++i) {
00319                 if (!strcmp(argv[i], "-h") || !strcmp(argv[i], "--help"))
00320                         usage(argv[0]);
00321         }
00322 
00323         MPI_Init(&argc, &argv);
00324         MPI_Comm_rank(MPI_COMM_WORLD, &rank);
00325         MPI_Comm_size(MPI_COMM_WORLD, &size);
00326 
00327                 /* Parse command line options */
00328         while (1) {
00329                 c = getopt(argc, argv, "d:e:ghn:s:vV:");
00330                 if (c == -1)
00331                         break;
00332 
00333                 switch (c) {
00334                 case 'd':
00335                         testdir = optarg;
00336                         break;
00337                 case 'e':
00338                         seed = (unsigned int)atoi(optarg);
00339                         break;
00340                 case 'g':
00341                         debug = 1;
00342                         break;
00343                 case 'h':
00344                         usage(argv[0]);
00345                         break;
00346                 case 'n':
00347                         iterations = atoi(optarg);
00348                         break;
00349                 case 's':
00350                         stride = atol(optarg);
00351                         break;
00352                 case 'v':
00353                         verbose += 1;
00354                         break;
00355                 case 'V':
00356                         verbose = atoi(optarg);
00357                         break;
00358                 }
00359         }
00360 
00361         if (rank == 0)
00362                 printf("%s is running with %d process(es) %s\n",
00363                        argv[0], size, debug ? "in DEBUG mode" : "\b\b");
00364 
00365         if (size < 2) {
00366                 fprintf(stderr,
00367                         "There should be at least 3 process to run the test!\n");
00368                 MPI_Abort(MPI_COMM_WORLD, 2);
00369         }
00370 
00371         if (testdir == NULL && rank == 0) {
00372                 fprintf(stderr, "Please specify a test directory! (\"%s -h\" for help)\n",
00373                        argv[0]);
00374                 MPI_Abort(MPI_COMM_WORLD, 2);
00375         }
00376 
00377         lp_gethostname();
00378 
00379         for (i = 0; i < iterations; ++i) {
00380                 if (rank == 0)
00381                         printf("%s: Running test #%s(iter %d)\n",
00382                                timestamp(), argv[0], i);
00383 
00384                 cascading_rw(stride, seed);
00385                 MPI_Barrier(MPI_COMM_WORLD);
00386         }
00387 
00388         if (rank == 0)
00389                 printf("%s: All tests passed!\n", timestamp());
00390         MPI_Finalize();
00391         return 0;
00392 }
